required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Construction and Validation of Risk Prediction Model for PICC Catheter Displacement
clinical_study.official_title: Construction and Validation of Risk Prediction Model for PICC Catheter Displacement

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: The occurrence of PICC catheter displacement is caused by many factors. In order to predict the risk of PICC and early warn high-risk patients, this study prospectively included patients with PICC catheter in a three Grade-A hospitals in June 2019, analyzed a variety of related factors, built a scientific and effective risk prediction model of PICC catheter displacement, and verified the goodness of fit and differential validity of the model.

primary_outcome.measure: Prediction Model of PICC catheter displacement
primary_outcome.description: A mathematical model for predicting PICC catheter displacement

intervention.description: Using logistic regression analysis to analyze the independent risk factors of PICC catheter displacement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with PICC
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with primary ectopia during PICC catheterization
- Patients with secondary ectopic adjusting length of catheter exposure
- Patients with mental illness and cognitive impairment
- Patients with incomplete clinical data

facility.name: 2nd Affilicated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University
